citeinfo.origin: Sonoran Desert Network, Inventory and Monitoring Program
citeinfo.title: Tumacácori National Historic Park Vegetation Mapping Project - Field Plot Location Points

descript.abstract: The plot point contains 92 point locations of field classification plots used by, and collected for, the vegetation mapping project for Tumacácori National Historic Park. Data was collected by field crews employeed by the Sonoran Desert Network, Inventory and Monitoring program (SODN). Points represent plot origin corners. Plots were located random locations but were orientated to best capture homogenous vegetation. Some few plots were placed subjectively in a second round of field efforts and these were placed in stands judged by field crews to represent legitimate vegetation types that had been under or not sampled during the first round. Plots locations collected in 2008 were GPSed (using Trimble RECONS or GeoXT units), coordinates were also noted on the field data sheets. One field photo is associated with each plot.
descript.purpose: Data were collected in 20 x 50 m plots to characterize the vegetation at Tumacácori National Historic Park. Species were recorded in three height classes with a cover class for each, lifeform notation and dominance ranking. These points show the location of plots sampled. The intended use of all data in the park's GIS library is to support diverse park activities including planning, management, maintenance, research, and interpretation.

theme.themekt: National Park Service Theme Category Thesaurus

idinfo.useconst: Acknowledgment of the SODN and the National Park Service would be appreciated in products derived from these data. Any person using the information presented here should fully understand the data collection and compilation process before beginning their analysis/use. The burden of determining fitness for use lies with the user.

cntorgp.cntorg: Sonoran Desert Network, Inventory and Monitoring Program

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.1850

citeinfo.origin: Drake, S., S. Buckley, M. Villarreal, S. Studd, and J. A. Hubbard. 2009.
citeinfo.title: Vegetation classification, distribution, and mapping report: Tumacácori National Historical Park.Natural Resource Report NPS/SODN/NRR—2009/148. National Park Service, Fort Collins, Colorado

attracc.attraccr: Network staff have ground checked and verified all features to the best of their knowledge. GIS personnel verified all features and attributes.

dataqual.logic: There are no duplicate features present.
dataqual.complete: This data contains all the classification plot points and photo points visited for the Tumacácori National Historical Park Vegetation Mapping Project.

horizpa.horizpar: The plot data was collected using Trimble GPS receivers. A meters error reading was recorded when applicable. Trimble GeoXT GPS receivers generally have horizontal errors of 1-3 meters. GPS accuracy varies for each plot.

citeinfo.origin: Arizona Remote Sensing Center, University of Arizona
citeinfo.title: qb_pansharp_tumm_sub.img

srcinfo.srccontr: Printed copies of the pan-sharpened image were used for field maps.

procstep.procdesc: Field plot data collection was accomplished with the use of Trimble RECON units or Trimble GeoXt units. Field crews used their judgment for the placement of photo locations. Plot locations were generated by SODN using a spatailly balanced and random algorithm tool in ArcGIS.
Data was entered into the SODN Plots (MS Access) database for Tumacácori National Historical Park and quality checked.
Shapefiles and database data was migrated to a personal file-based geodatabase format.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Unique number with park 4 letter code followed by IP and sequential numbers

overview.eaover: OBJECT_ID - Object ID - ESRI automatically generated unique ID. SHAPE - Geometry - ESRI automatically generated geometry type. PLOT_CODE - Text - Unique plot code created for each location visited. X - Single - X coordinate or easting Y - Single - Y coordinate or northing

distinfo.distliab:

Any related graphics (if available) are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not approriate to use the related graphics as data.
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service servers and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data.
